name: 陳彥璋
objective: This course is directed to applications of fluid mechanics, hydrology, and hydraulics as they apply to the discipline of water resources engineering.  Topics covered include flow in closed conduits and open channels, hydraulic machinery (pumps), and surface water hydrology and statistical methods.  At the successful completion of this course, the student will be able to apply the fundamental principles of conservation of mass, momentum and energy to the practical solution of both analysis and design problems in closed and open conduit flows.  The student will also be introduced to hydrology and to methods of quantification of hydrologic uncertainty.
schedule:
1.　　Introduction
2.　　Descriptive and quantitative hydrology
3.　　Groundwater
4.　　Probability concepts in planning
5.　　Reservoirs
6.　　Dams
7.　　Spillways, gates and outlet works
8.　　Pressure conduits
9.　　Open channels
10.　　Hydraulic machinery
11.　　Engineering economy in water resources
12.　　Irrigation
13.　　Hydroelectric power
14.　　Drainage
15.　　Flood damage mitigation
materials:
Linsley, R.K., Franzini, J.B., Freyberg, D.L., Tchobanoglous, G., Water-Resources
Engineering. 4th ed. McGraw-Hill.1992.
